name: Aren Suites

reviews.text: This hotel was a great start to our holiday. We were made to feel welcome, the rooms were very clean and bright. The staff were pleasent and helpful. Most places are within walking distance to the hotel. Check out the views from the roof, it's great to relax in the evening. Would highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: "A home away from home'' is one of the many things we can say about Aren Suites. We are a family of 5 that includes a baby.It's a little bit on the smaller side, but nonetheless, it was very comfortable.The staff were extremely kind and helpful. Everytime we would come back to the hotel from a trip around Istanbul, the people at the reception would be welcoming us like we were just checking in. The free breakfast was great and we looked forward to it everyday. The rooms, as I mentioned were not as big as other hotels, but they were clean, decorated, and had lots of amenities.The rooftop had a magnificent view of the sea and the Blue Mosque. The main highlights of Istanbul were at a short walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially to family oriented people.
reviews.title: Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful

reviews.text: Staying at the Aren Suites was a wonderful experience. We were a family traveling with a small baby. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were great (well furnished, clean, beautifully decorated), with a good breakfast buffet. What you pay for this hotel is more than justified.
reviews.title: Central hotel in downtown Istambul, great for family travel

reviews.text: In addition, the hotel was perfectly located right in the middle of the old city, about 500m from the Blue Mosque.
reviews.title: A very fitting finale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our trip, our baby got sick and the hotel manager was very helpful calling the emergency service and then referring us to a hospital.
reviews.title: Feeling at home in Istanbul-perfect small boutique hotel in Old Sultanameht

reviews.text: I stayed at Aren Suites and it was one of my best experiences. The hotel has very comfortable and modern rooms. And the terrace is lovely. I reccomend everybody to have couple cups of turkish tea (cay) there. If you are an author or song writer, you will agree with me: you will enjoy your time writing there while seeing the beauty of Istanbul and feel like the part of local people. And the most important point is the staff. They are very helpful and kind. They answered all my questions with patience and came with many solutions. I will be back to this hotel soon and learn about Istanbul more ;)
reviews.title: Best Time in The Best Place

reviews.text: I had a short but great time in Istanbul ... my hotel was perfectly located, all historical attractions are within walking distance so exploring the city was very easy ... though I would have loved to spend more time in the hotel: clean, tastefully decorated and comfortable room, very good breakfast, lovely roof! great service, everybody was doing their best to make me feel at home and I felt I was given VIP treatment (Thank you, Mehmet Sümengen (a manager who really cares) ! ... great job, Furkan! (the most helpful, patient and polite receptionist I've ever come across - with a good sense of humour ;)) .. I'll be back, next time with my family! :)

The hotel is on a low key, quiet street, but just a few steps away from restaurants, bazaar, and of course the three must see sights in Istanbul, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia.

reviews.text: We did hear our next door neighbor through the thin walls as other reviewers have noted previously. But we had no problem w/ noises at night and the wonderful staff makes up for whatever the small hotel lacks otherwise.

reviews.text: I found the breakfast to be perfectly adequate and always fresh. And the staff is always trying to please you and get you whatever you need.
reviews.title: The biggest small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few suggestions for first time visitors...We found Istanbul street addresses to be pretty useless. Small streets are not marked on the tourist map, and many of the streets don't have names marked. On two occasion when we got too tired to walk back, we got in a taxi and gave him a hotel business card to take us back. Neither of the drivers had no idea where the hotel or the street the hotel was located. One of them had to use a GPS and the other driver stopped and asked people on the street. It's better to orient yourself from Sultamet Square or the Mosque and either walk from there (it's about two blocks) or tell the driver how to get to the hotel.
reviews.title: an excellent choice

reviews.text: We ate at the seafood restaurant the hotel HIGHLY recommended which had a pretty nice view on the roof top. I cannot say that our 200TL meal was any better than the 50TL meal we had at the restaurant next door. Every meal we had in Istanbul was fresh, flavorful, and just amazing. There's no need to pay the premium for the view you would get at the hotel roof top.
reviews.title: NIce, but disappointed in service

reviews.text: Stayed with family for five days. Our experience at this hotel was great. It is brand new hotel so every thing was in order, neat and clean. Breakfast was good and never short of things. The room was cleaned every day. The staff are very courteous and helpful. Location is excellent yet the area is quiet. Our room had a great view of the marmara sea. I hope the management keeps their standards and maintainence levels high so the customers in future can also enjoy their stay just like us.
reviews.title: Very nice experience. Met the expectations.
Nice. Would stay there again.
reviews.text: New, nice and clean hotel. Spacious room. Attentive and helpful staff. Jaccuzi in bathroom is nice to have at end of the day. Good view on the rooftop. Location is quite central as it is near to all the sites, though it is a steep walk to the train station. Breakfast could be better. I would recommend this hotel.
I stayed one week in this hotel and the experience was wonderful !
